covered: POST/Valid Payload: Success scenarios with required-only and all optional headers/fields (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC16).
POST/Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON, missing required fields, empty body, missing required header, and invalid header types (TC04, TC05, TC06, TC08, TC12).
POST/Large Payloads: Boundary test with maximum allowed field sizes (TC11).
POST/Duplicate Submission: Duplicate handling considered, though expectation is ambiguous (TC13).
POST/Server Error Handling: Dependency failure simulated with 503; network timeout 504 adds resiliency coverage (TC10, TC14).
Success response details: Verifies 201, JSON Account object, and Location header presence (TC01–TC03, TC16, TC20).
Integration sanity: Created resource retrievable via Location (TC20).
gaps: POST/Validation depth: No field-level validation cases (e.g., email format, numeric ranges, UUID formats, enum constraints).
POST/Server Error Handling: No 500 Internal Server Error scenario or standardized error response schema assertions.
POST/Duplicate Submission: TC13 has non-deterministic expectation (201 or 409). Needs clear policy and deterministic setup/assertions.
Content negotiation and headers: No tests for incorrect/missing Content-Type (e.g., 415), Accept header handling (406), or asserting response Content-Type=application/json.
Header edge cases: No tests for empty string/whitespace/overly long X-Killbill-CreatedBy, or invalid types for optional headers.
Location header quality: Presence checked, but not format/resolve-ability (absolute/relative URL, points to GET-able resource consistently).
Error body structure: Negative tests don’t assert standardized error contract (fields like code, message, type).
Security hardening: XSS/Injection test (TC15) has ambiguous expected outcome; lacks explicit sanitization/validation rules and consistent status code.
recommendations: Add field-level validation scenarios: invalid email format, out-of-range numbers, bad country/currency/locale codes, invalid UUIDs for IDs.
Add server error simulation returning 500 with proper error payload; assert error schema across 4xx/5xx.
Make duplicate policy explicit: pre-create an account, then POST same unique keys and assert definitive 409 (or documented behavior); remove “201 or 409”.
Add content negotiation tests: wrong/missing Content-Type -> 415; unsupported Accept -> 406; assert response Content-Type=application/json on success and errors.
Extend header validation: empty/blank/overlong X-Killbill-CreatedBy; invalid types/lengths for X-Killbill-Reason/Comment; assert 400 with clear messages.
Validate Location header: assert correct URL pattern and that GET on it returns 200 and matches created resource (already partly in TC20).
Assert standardized error response structure for all negative cases (keys like errorType, errorCode, message).
Clarify TC15: Define concrete expectation (e.g., 400 with validation error; or 201 with sanitized fields) and assert escaping/sanitization explicitly.
